## Workflow Dependencies

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Main CI] --> B[Gateway Tests]
    A --> C[Router Tests]
    A --> D[Worker Tests]
    A --> E[Rust Worker]
    B --> F[Summary]
    C --> F
    D --> F
    E --> F
    
    N[Nightly Tests] --> N1[Router Heavy]
    N --> N2[R10 E2E Heavy]
    N --> N3[R10 Property]
    N --> N4[NATS Perf]
    N1 --> NS[Nightly Summary]
    N2 --> NS
    N3 --> NS
    N4 --> NS
    
    B1[Gateway Observability] --> B2[Gateway Coverage]
    D1[Worker Observability] --> D2[Worker Coverage]
```

## File Organization

```
.github/
â”œâ”€â”€ workflows/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ci.yml                      # Main CI orchestrator
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ gateway-tests.yml           # Gateway component tests
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ router-tests.yml            # Router component tests
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ worker-tests.yml            # Worker component tests
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ nightly-tests.yml           # Heavy/scheduled tests
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ validate-cp2.yml            # CP2 validation
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ci-validate.yml             # CI validation
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ devstate-hooks-tests.yml    # DevState hooks
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ README.md                   # Workflows documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ QUICKSTART.md                   # Quick start guide
â”œâ”€â”€ GITHUB_ACTIONS_MIGRATION.md     # Migration from GitLab
â””â”€â”€ WORKFLOW_STRUCTURE.md           # This file
```

## Key Features

### âœ… Concurrency Control
Each workflow has concurrency groups to cancel in-progress runs:
```yaml
concurrency:
  group: ci-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true
```

### âœ… Path Filters
Workflows run only when relevant files change:
```yaml
on:
  push:
    paths:
      - 'apps/c-gateway/**'
```

### âœ… Caching
Dependencies are cached for faster builds:
- Erlang rebar3 cache
- Node.js pnpm cache

### âœ… Matrix Builds
Router tests run on multiple Erlang versions (25.3, 26.0)

### âœ… Reusable Workflows
Component tests are reusable workflows called from main CI

## Migration from GitLab CI

All GitLab CI jobs have equivalent GitHub Actions workflows:
- Same test coverage
- Same quality gates
- Same artifact retention
- Parallel execution where possible

See [GITHUB_ACTIONS_MIGRATION.md](GITHUB_ACTIONS_MIGRATION.md) for details.
